What is the total number of valence electrons in a sulfide ion in the ground state?
Sunday, 07 November 2010 01:02 QUESTION like what is a sulfide ion? I can't find it on the periodic table. ANSWER Sulfide ion = S -2 [ Sulphur ion which has gained 2 electrons] S has 6 valence electrons, so sulfide will have 6+2 = 8 Science&Mathematics - Chemistry Latest Answers
